intro: Crotalaria luteoviolacea, commonly known as the violet cowpea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking violet to yellow flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Crotalaria luteoviolacea is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
